ADDGRID.description: Determines whether an additional support grid is used for the evaluation of the augmentation charges.

AEXX.description: Specifies the fraction of exact exchange in a Hartree-Fock-type/hybrid-functional calculation.

AGGAC.description: Is a parameter that multiplies the gradient correction in the GGA correlation functional.

AGGAX.description: Is a parameter that multiplies the gradient correction in the GGA exchange functional.

ALDAC.description: Is a parameter that multiplies the LDA correlation functional or the LDA part of the GGA correlation functional.

ALDAX.description: Is a parameter that multiplies the LDA exchange functional or the LDA part of the GGA exchange functional.

ALGO.description: Is a convenient option to specify the electronic minimization algorithm (as of VASP.4.5) and/or to select the type of GW calculations.

AMIN.description: specifies the minimal mixing parameter in Kerker's initial approximation to the charge-dielectric function used in the Broyden/Pulay mixing scheme (IMIX=4, INIMIX=1).

AMIX_MAG.description: Linear mixing parameter for the magnetization density.

ANDERSEN_PROB.description: Sets the collision probability in Andersen thermostat.

ANTIRES.description: determines whether the Tamm-Dancoff approximation is used or not.

AMGGAC.description: is a parameter that multiplies the meta-GGA correlation functional (available as of VASP.6.4.0).

AMGGAX.description: is a parameter that multiplies the meta-GGA exchange functional (available as of VASP.6.4.0).

APACO.description: sets the maximum distance in the evaluation of the pair-correlation function (in Å).

BANDGAP.description: determines the verbosity for reporting the bandgap to the OUTCAR file. Only the first character is significant.

BEXT.description: Specifies an external magnetic field in eV. A single value for ISPIN=2, or three values for LNONCOLLINEAR=.TRUE.

BMIX.description: sets the cutoff wave vector for Kerker mixing scheme (IMIX=1 and/or INIMIX=1).

BMIX_MAG.description: sets the cutoff wave vector for Kerker mixing scheme for the magnetization density (IMIX=1 and/or INIMIX=1).

BPARAM.description: The tag BPARAM specifies the value of the parameter b in the kernel of the nonlocal rVV10 correlation functional.

BSEELECTRON.description: sets the coordinates of the fixed electron of the exciton wavefunction

BSEHOLE.description: sets the coordinates of the fixed hole of the exciton wavefunction

BSEPREC.description: determines the precision of the time-evolution algorithm for solving the Bethe-Salpeter or Casida equations, i.e., the timestep and the number of steps.

CH_AMPLIFICATION.description: This tag is used to scale (amplify) the calculated dielectric function within the supercell core-hole method and the BSE+GW method for core electrons.

CH_LSPEC.description: This flag controls whether the dielecectric function using the supercell core-hole method is calculated or not.

CH_NEDOS.description: This tag specifies the number of frequency (energy) grid points on the x-axis in the calculation of the dielectric function in the supercell core-hole method.

CH_SIGMA.description: This tag specifies the width of the Gaussian broadening in eV of the imaginary dielectric function within the supercell core-hole method.

CLL.description: selects the angular quantum number l of the excited core electron when using ICORELEVEL>0.

CLN.description: selects the main quantum number n of the excited core electron when using ICORELEVEL>0.

CLNT.description: selects the type of the excited atoms in XAS calculations with ICORELEVEL>0.

CLZ.description: selects a fractional or the full electron charge for the core hole in the core-excitation calculations with ICORELEVEL=2.

CMBJ.description: defines the c parameter in the MBJ potential.

CMBJA.description: sets the α parameter in the MBJ and LMBJ potentials.

CMBJE.description: sets the e parameter in the MBJ and local MBJ potentials.

CPARAM.description: The tag CPARAM allows to specify the value of the parameter C in the kernel of the nonlocal rVV10 correlation functional.

CSHIFT.description: sets a Lorentzian broadening in eV of the dielectric tensor via the complex shift
CSHIFT.default_rule: 0.1 if {LOPTICS} else {OMEGAMAX} * 1.3 / max({NOMEGA}, 40) if "GW calculations" else 0.1

CUTOFF_MU.default_rule: 0.8 * Fermi level of a system with {NUM_WANN} orbitals occupied

CUTOFF_TYPE.description: chooses the type of cutoff function to be used before performing the singular-value decomposition (SVD) of the initial projections matrix.

DEPER.description: specifies a relative stopping criterion for the optimization of an eigenvalue.

DIMER_DIST.description: The flag DIMER_DIST defines the step size for the numerical differentiation (in

DIPOL.description: specifies the center of the cell in direct lattice coordinates with respect to which the total dipole-moment in the cell is calculated.

DQ.description: step size for the finite difference k-space derivative in the linear response calculation of chemical shifts.

EBREAK.description: specifies an absolute stopping criterion for the optimization of an eigenvalue.

EDIFF.description: specifies the global break condition for the electronic SC-loop. EDIFF is specified in units of eV.

EDIFFG.description: defines the break condition for the ionic relaxation loop.

EFERMI.description: Defines how the Fermi energy is calculated in VASP. It is recommended to use EFERMI = MIDGAP.

EFIELD.description: controls the magnitude of the applied electric force field.

EFIELD_PEAD.description: specifies the homogeneous electric force field in the electric enthalpy functional used to compute the self-consistent response to finite electric fields. EFIELD_PEAD is specified in units of eV/

EINT.description: The EINT tag allows specifying an energy range for which the partial charge density is calculated.

ELPH_DECOMPOSE.description: The ELPH_DECOMPOSE tag determines whether the contributions to the electron self-energy from different phonon branches are computed separately.

ELPH_DRIVER.description: Chooses which driver to use for electron-phonon calculations.

ELPH_IGNORE_IMAG_PHONONS.description: The ELPH_IGNORE_IMAG_PHONONS tag determines how imaginary phonon modes are treated in the calculation of electron-phonon coupling and related properties.

ELPH_ISMEAR.description: The ELPH_ISMEAR tag specifies the smearing method used for the electronic occupations in the electron-phonon coupling calculations.

ELPH_KSPACING.description: The tag ELPH_KSPACING determines the k point mesh if the KPOINTS_ELPH file is not present.

ELPH_LR.description: Controls the treatment of the long-range part of the electron-phonon potential.

ELPH_MODE.description: Meta tag that selects reasonable defaults for electron-phonon calculations

ELPH_NBANDS.description: Number of bands to compute on the dense k point grid for the electron-phonon driver

ELPH_NBANDS_SUM.description: Number of intermediate states to include in the computation of the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_POT_FFT_MESH.description: Specifies the FFT mesh for mapping the electron-phonon potential to the primitive cell.

ELPH_POT_GENERATE.description: Calculates the electron-phonon potential from finite atomic displacements.

ELPH_POT_LATTICE.description: Allows specifying an alternative primitive cell for the mapping of the electron-phonon potential.

ELPH_RUN.description: Select whether to run and electron-phonon calculation.

ELPH_SCATTERING_APPROX.description: Select which type of approximation is used to compute the electron scattering lifetimes due to electron-phonon coupling

ELPH_SELFEN_BAND_START.description: Compute the electron self-energy due to electron-phonon coupling only for bands with indices starting from ELPH_SELFEN_BAND_START.

ELPH_SELFEN_BAND_STOP.description: Compute the electron self-energy due to electron-phonon coupling only for bands with indices until ELPH_SELFEN_BAND_STOP.

ELPH_SELFEN_CARRIER_DEN.description: List of additional carrier densities in units of cm^{-3} at which to compute the phonon-mediated electron self-energy and transport coefficients.

ELPH_SELFEN_CARRIER_PER_CELL.description: List of additional number of carriers for which to compute the phonon-mediated electron self-energy and transport coefficients.

ELPH_SELFEN_DELTA.description: Complex imaginary shift to use when computing the self-energy due to electron-phonon coupling.

ELPH_SELFEN_DW.description: Controls whether the Debye-Waller contribution is included in the calculation of the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_SELFEN_FAN.description: Controls whether the Fan-Migdal contribution is included in the calculation of the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_SELFEN_GAPS.description: Find the direct and indirect gaps and the valence and conduction Kohn-Sham states that form it and select to compute their self-energy due to electron-phonon coupling.

ELPH_SELFEN_IKPT.description: Compute the electron self-energy due to electron-phonon for a list of k-points specified by their index in the irreducible Brillouin zone generated from KPOINTS_ELPH.

ELPH_SELFEN_KPTS.description: Computes the electron self-energy due to electron-phonon for a list of k-points specified by their fractional coordinates.

ELPH_SELFEN_MU.description: List of chemical potentials at which to compute the phonon-mediated electron self-energy and transport coefficients.

ELPH_SELFEN_NW.description: Number of energies to use when computing the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_SELFEN_STATIC.description: Activates the adiabatic approximation for the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_SELFEN_TEMPS.description: List of temperatures for which to compute the electron self-energy due to electron-phonon coupling.

ELPH_SELFEN_WRANGE.description: Together with ELPH_SELFEN_NW specifies the energy window in which to evaluate the phonon-induced electron self-energy.

ELPH_TRANSPORT.description: Activates transport calculation involving electron-phonon coupling

ELPH_TRANSPORT_DFERMI_TOL.description: choose the percentage of the integral of the derivative of the Fermi-dirac distribution with respect to the energy that is excluded from the integral that yields the Onsager coefficients.

ELPH_TRANSPORT_DRIVER.description: choose method to compute the Onsager coefficients, which are then used to compute the transport coefficients.

ELPH_TRANSPORT_EMAX.description: Upper bound of the energy window in which states are considered for transport calculations.

ELPH_TRANSPORT_EMIN.description: Lower bound of the energy window in which states are considered for transport calculations.

ELPH_USEBLAS.description: Toggles the use of BLAS routines for computing electron-phonon matrix elements.

EMAX.description: specifies the upper boundary of the energy range for the evaluation of the electronic density of states (DOS).

EMIN.description: specifies the lower boundary of the energy range for the evaluation of the electronic density of states (DOS).

ENAUG.description: Specifies the cutoff energy of the plane-wave representation of the augmentation charges in eV.

ENCUT.description: specifies the energy cutoff for the plane-wave basis set in eV.

ENCUTFOCK.description: The ENCUTFOCK tag sets the energy cutoff that determines the FFT grids used by the Hartree-Fock routines.

ENCUTGW.description: The tag ENCUTGW sets the energy cutoff for the response function.

ENCUTGWSOFT.description: The flag ENCUTGWSOFT sets the energy cutoff for the response function, such that it allows to truncate the Coulomb kernel slowly between the energy specified by ENCUTGWSOFT and ENCUTGW using a cosine window function.

ENCUTLR.description: Reciprocal space cutoff for the treatment of the long-range contribution.

ENINI.description: controls the cutoff during the initial (steepest descent) phase for IALGO=48.

EPSILON.description: sets the dielectric constant of the medium.

ESTOP.description: specifies the stop condition for stochastic MP2.

EVENONLY.description: selects a subset of '''k'''-points for the representation of the Fock exchange potential, with ''C''<sub>1</sub>=''C''<sub>2</sub>=''C''<sub>3</sub>=1, and ''n''<sub>1</sub>+''n''<sub>2</sub>+''n''<sub>3</sub> even.

EVENONLYGW.description: allows to restrict the k-points in the evaluation of response functions (in GW calculations) to even values.

FBIAS_A.description: Defines the step height for the bias potential in <math>eV</math>.

FBIAS_D.description: Sets the slope of the bias potential.

FBIAS_R0.description: Defines the half-step position for the bias potential.

FERDO.description: sets the occupancies of the states in the down-spin channel for ISMEAR=-2 and ISPIN=2.

FERWE.description: sets the occupancies of the states for ISMEAR=-2.

FINDIFF.description: Defines whether a forward (FINDIFF=1) or a central (FINDIFF=2) difference formula for the numerical differentiation to compute the curvature along the dimer direction is used in the improved dimer method.

FMP_ACTIVE.description: Select which atom types in the POSCAR-file participate in swapping within the Müller-Plathe method.

FMP_DIRECTION.description: Index of the lattice vector a_i along which the temperature gradient is created in the (Müller-Plathe method).

FMP_PERIOD.description: Number of time steps between two swapping events in the Müller-Plathe method.

FMP_SNUMBER.description: Number of slabs perpendicular to the temperature gradient in the Müller-Plathe method.

FMP_SWAPNUM.description: Number of pairs that are exchanged in a single swapping event in the Müller-Plathe method.

FOCKCORR.description: The tag FOCKCORR determines how the Coulomb convergence corrections are applied.

GGA.description: Selects a LDA or GGA exchange-correlation functional.

GGA_COMPAT.description: If set to GGA_COMPAT = .FALSE., this tag restores the full lattice symmetry for gradient-corrected functionals.

HFALPHA.description: sets the decay constant used in the method of Massida, Posternak, and Baldereschi, which is activated by HFRCUT=0.

HFLMAX.description: To be compatible w.r.t. old releases, VASP also reads the flag HFLMAX to the same effect as LMAXFOCK.

HFRCUT.description: specifies how the Coulomb kernel is approximated at G=0 when the Fock energy and the exchange potential are evaluated.

HFSCREEN.description: specifies the range-separation parameter in range-separated hybrid functionals.

HILLS_BIN.description: sets the number of steps after which the bias potential is updated in a metadynamics run (in case VASP was compiled with -Dtbdyn).

HILLS_H.description: specifies the height of the Gaussian hill (in eV) used in metadynamics (in case VASP was compiled with -Dtbdyn).

HILLS_W.description: specifies the width of the Gaussian hill (in units of the corresponding collective variable) used in metadynamics (in case VASP was compiled with -Dtbdyn).

HITOLER.description: specifies the convergence parameter for the iterative Hirschfeld partitioning in the Tkatchenko-Scheffler method.

I_CONSTRAINED_M.description: switches on the constrained local moments approach.

IALGO.description: selects the algorithm to optimize the orbitals.

IALL_IN_ONE.description: enables the all-in-one mode for many-body perturbation theory calculations, i.e., ALGO=ACFDT[R], [EV]GW0[R], GWR.

IBAND.description: sets a list of bands that contribute to calculating the partial charge density.

IBRION.description: determines how the crystal structure changes during the calculation:

IBSE.description: can be used to select the algorithm for solving the Bethe-Salpeter or Casida equation.

ICHARG.description: determines how VASP constructs the initial charge density.

ICHIBARE.description: determines the order of the finite difference stencil used to calculate the magnetic susceptibility.

ICORELEVEL.description: controls whether the core energies are explicitly calculated or not and how they are calculated.

IDIPOL.description: switches on monopole/dipole and quadrupole corrections to the total energy in a specific direction (1-3) or all directions (4)

IEPSILON.description: determines along which Cartesian direction the E field is applied.

IFC_ASR.description: If positive, enforces the acoustic sum rule on the interatomic force constants during an electron-phonon calculation.

IFC_LR.description: Controls the treatment of the long-range part of the interatomic force constants during electron-phonon calculations.

IPEAD.description: Specify the order of the finite difference stencil used to compute the derivative of the cell-periodic part of the orbitals

ISIF.description: Determines if the stress tensor is calculated and which ionic degrees of freedom are varied.

ISMEAR.description: determines how the partial occupancies fnk are set for each orbital.

ISTART.description: Determines whether or not to read the WAVECAR file.

IVDW.description: specifies a vdW dispersion term of the atom-pairwise or many-body type

KPAR.description: sets the number of k-points that are to be treated in parallel

KPUSE.description: sets a list of k points that contribute to calculating the partial charge density

LASPH.description: Include non-spherical contributions related to the gradient of the density in the PAW spheres.

LATTICE_CONSTRAINTS.description: Sets three boolean to selectively allow changes in the lattice vectors.

LCHARG.description: determines whether the charge densities (files CHGCAR and CHG) are written

LCHARGH5.description: determines whether the charge densities are written to vaspwave.h5

LDAU.description: The main control tag to switch on DFT+U

LDAUJ.description: Sets the effective on-site exchange interactions (eV).

LDAUL.description: specifies the l-quantum number for which the on-site interaction is added.

LDAUU.description: Sets the effective on-site Coulomb interactions (eV).

LDIAG.description: Determines whether a subspace diagonalization is performed within the algorithm selected by ALGO or IALGO

LEFG.description: Computes the electric field gradient (EFG) at positions of the atomic nuclei.

LEPSILON.description: Determines the static dielectric matrix, ion-clamped piezoelectric tensor, and the Born effective charges using density functional perturbation theory.

LH5.description: determines whether the output is written to the legacy files (CHGCAR, CHG, WAVECAR) or the vaspwave.h5 file

LHARTREE.description: Controls whether the bubble diagrams are included in the BSE calculation.

LHFCALC.description: Specifies whether a Hartree-Fock/DFT hybrid functional type calculation is performed

LHYPERFINE.description: Compute the hyperfine tensors at the atomic sites (available as of vasp.5.3.2).

LOPTICS.description: Calculates the frequency dependent dielectric matrix after the electronic ground state has been determined.

LORBIT.description: Selects a projection method onto local quantum numbers (lm) and writes PROCAR/PROOUT file.

LPARD.description: Determines whether partial (band and/or k-point-decomposed) charge densities are evaluated.

LPARDH5.description: Determines whether the partial charges are written to PARCHG or vaspout.h5.

LPEAD.description: whether to calculate the derivative of the cell-periodic part of the orbitals

LREAL.description: Determines whether the projection operators are evaluated in real-space or in reciprocal space.

LVHAR.description: Determines whether the local potential V_ion + V_hartree (in eV) is written to the LOCPOT file.

LVTOT.description: Determines whether the total local potential V_locpot (in eV) is written to the LOCPOT file.

LWAVE.description: Determines whether the wavefunctions are written to the WAVECAR file at the end of a run.

LWAVEH5.description: Determines whether the wavefunctions are written to vaspwave.h5 file at the end of a run.

MAGMOM.description: Initial magnetic moment for each atom if no magnetization density is present. Considered when symmetry is determined.

NBANDS.description: Specifies the total number of KS or QP orbitals in the calculation.

NCORE.description: Determines the number of compute cores that work on an individual orbital

NELM.description: Sets the maximum number of electronic SC (self-consistency) steps.

NELMIN.description: Specifies the minimum number of electronic self-consistency steps.

NFREE.description: Specifies the number of remembered steps in the history of ionic convergence runs, or the number of ionic displacements in frozen phonon calculations.

NPAR.description: Determines the number of bands that are treated in parallel.

NSIM.description: Sets the number of bands that are optimized simultaneously by the RMM-DIIS algorithm

NSW.description: Sets the maximum number of ionic steps

NUPDOWN.description: Sets the difference between the number of electrons in the up and down spin components.

NWRITE.description: This tag determines how much will be written to the file OUTCAR ('verbosity tag').

POTIM.description: Sets the time step in molecular dynamics or the step width in ionic relaxations.

QUAD_EFG.description: nuclear quadrupole moment (in millbarn) for the atomic types on the POTCAR file.

SIGMA.description: Specifies the width of the smearing in eV.

SYSTEM.description: The 'title string' defined by SYSTEM is for the user only and should help the user to identify what he/she wants to do with this specific input file.

TIME.description: Controls the time step for IALGO=5X and for the initial (steepest descent) phase of IALGO=4X.
